intro: Bomarea patacocensis, commonly known as the Patacón bomarea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in cloud forests at elevations between 1,500 and 2,500 meters. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, and it produces underground tubers that serve as storage organs. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
